page.title: 10Whetsted Farm, Paddock Wood
page.content: The main crop on farms in the area used to be hops,as can be seen by the numerous oasthouses still seen in the vicinity.Due to a lessening in demand and a disease which hit the crops in the 50's hops are not so widely grown. Whetsted covers 174 acres of which 50% is arable with the remaining 50% given over to sheep.At present there are 150 ewes and 250 lambs on the farm. Redland Tiles Ltd. have bought 40 acres of land from the farm for gravel excavation. When the excavation has been completed,the land will be reclaimed and revert to farmland. Apparently,since the excavation began, wildlife in the area has increased,and a rare variety of owl was sighted last year. The farm employs 2 full time workers and one summer worker.
